snippet: Variety, a magazine that once was considered the bible of Hollywood, has been sold for about $25 million in what “was essentially a fire sale,” the Media Decoder blog reports. Penske Media, the owner of a collection of entertainment news blogs,...
abstract: Variety, a magazine that once was considered the bible of Hollywood, has been sold for about $25 million in what “was essentially a fire sale,” the Media Decoder blog reports. Penske Media, the owner of a collection of entertainment news blogs, teamed up with the hedge fund Third Point to acquire the magazine.
lead_paragraph: Variety, a magazine that once was considered the bible of Hollywood, has been sold for about $25 million in what “was essentially a fire sale,” the Media Decoder blog reports. Penske Media, the owner of a collection of entertainment news blogs, teamed up with the hedge fund Third Point to acquire the magazine. Read more »

headline.main: Variety Magazine Sold for About $25 Million
